      • AssignPropertyVariable

        public static boolean AssignPropertyVariable(Component comp,
                             java.lang.String property,
                             java.lang.String variable)
        Assign object property to a variable. The property could be attribute or CSS property.
        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map) to get property.
        property - -- attribute or CSS property.
        variable - -- the name of the variable to receive the proeprty value.
        Returns:
        true on success.
        Example:
         String labelVar = "labelVar";
 Component.AssignPropertyVariable(Map.AUT.Lable,"textContent", labelVar);
 String label = SeleniumPlus.GetVariableValue(labelVar);

      • CaptureObjectDataToFile

        public static boolean CaptureObjectDataToFile(Component comp,
                              java.lang.String fileName,
                              java.lang.String... params)
        Copy the current contents of a component's data to a file.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to retrieve data.
        fileName - String, The file containing the component's data.
        params - optional
          params[0] encoding String, The file encoding
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         boolean success = Component.CaptureObjectDataToFile(Map.SampleApp.ListView, "listview.dat");
 boolean success = Component.CaptureObjectDataToFile(Map.SampleApp.ListView, "listview.dat", "utf-8");
 boolean success = Component.CaptureObjectDataToFile(Map.SampleApp.ListView, "d:\testproj\test\listview.dat");

      • CapturePropertiesToFile

        public static boolean CapturePropertiesToFile(Component comp,
                              java.lang.String file,
                              java.lang.String... fileEncoding)
        Copy all of the value properties a test object to a file.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component (from App Map) to retrieve all properties.
        file - String, to store all properties
        fileEncoding - String, the encoding of the file. optional, default is the system-encoding.
        Returns:
        True on success, a file will be created into Actuals dir
        Example:
         Component.CapturePropertiesToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "singin.properties");
 Component.CapturePropertiesToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "singin.properties", "UTF-8");

      • CapturePropertyToFile

        public static boolean CapturePropertyToFile(Component comp,
                            java.lang.String property,
                            java.lang.String file,
                            java.lang.String... fileEncoding)
        Copy a propertie's value of a test object to to a file.
        Parameters:
        property - String, the property name to get value
        comp - Component (from App Map) to retrieve property's value
        fileEncoding - String, the encoding of the file. optional, default is the system-encoding.
        Returns:
        boolean, True on success and a file will be created into Actuals dir
        Example:
         Component.CapturePropertyToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "display", "singin.dispaly.dat");
 Component.CapturePropertyToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "color", "singin.color.dat", "UTF-8");

      • ClearCache

        public static boolean ClearCache(Component comp)
        Some components like Tree, Menu may have a cache containing their content or time-consuming
        resource, which will speed up the test. But the cache may contain obsolete objects, and they will
        affect the test, to use component's latest data, user needs call this method to clear the cache
        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map) from which to clear the cache.
        Returns:
        -- True if the component's cache has been cleared.
        Example:
         boolean success = Tree.ClickTextNode(Map.Google.Tree, "Root->Child1->GrandChild");
 Component.ClearCache(Map.Google.Tree);
 boolean success = Tree.CaptureTreeDataToFile(Map.Google.Tree, "D:\data\tree.dat");

      • DragTo

        public static boolean DragTo(Component from,
             Component to,
             java.lang.String... optionals)
        A left mouse drag is performed from one object to another object based on the offsets values.

        See Detailed Reference

        Parameters:
        from - Component, the component (from App Map) relative to which to calculate start coordinates to drag
        to - Component, the component (from App Map) relative to which to calculate end coordinates to drag
        params - optional
          params[0] offsets String, indicating the offset relative to component in percentage or in pixel, like "20%,10%, %50, %60", "30, 55, 70, 80", or even "20%,10%, 70, 80". If not provided, then "50%, 50%, 50%, 50%" will be used as default value, which means the drag point is the center of the component.
          params[1] fromSubItem String, as text. e.g tree node or list item or any sub main component's item.
          params[2] toSubItem String, as text. e.g tree node or list item or any sub main component item.
        Returns:
        true if successfully executed, false otherwise.

        Sets prevResults TestRecordHelper to the results received or null if an error occurred.

        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         boolean success = DragTo(Map.Google.Apps, Map.Google.Area);//Left-Drag from center of component Map.Google.Apps to center of component Map.Google.Area
 boolean success = DragTo(Map.Google.Apps, Map.Google.Area, "20%,10%, %50, %60");//Left-Drag from (20%,10%) of component Map.Google.Apps to (%50, %60) of component Map.Google.Area
 //one of the above and then,
 int rc = prevResults.getStatusCode();      // if useful
 String info = prevResults.getStatusInfo(); // if useful

      • GetTextFromGUI

        public static boolean GetTextFromGUI(Component comp,
                     java.lang.String variable,
                     java.lang.String... params)
        Incorporate OCR technology to detect the text on a GUI component and save the text to a variable. See Detailed Reference
        This requires that SAFS-OCR has been installed.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component (from App Map) from which to retrieve text.
        variable - String, The name of the variable to receive detected text.
        params - optional
          params[0] SubArea String, indicating partial image of the component to capture, it can be app map subkey referring a subarea or the subarea itself like "5,10, %50, %60"
          params[1] OCRId String, indicating the OCR used to recognize text. TOCR or GORC
          params[2] LangId String, representing the language in use for selected OCR to recognize text. "en", "cn" etc.
          params[3] ScaleRatio float, indicating the scale ratio for resizing the original image. "1.5"
        Returns:
        boolean, True on success and the text will be saved to a variable
        Example:
         Component.GetTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "signinText");
 String value = SeleniumPlus.GetVariableValue("signinText");
 Component.GetTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "signinText", "", "GOCR");
 Component.GetTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "signinText", "5,10, %50, %60", "TOCR", "en", "1.5");
 Component.GetTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, quote("signin-partial"), "0, 0, 70%, 100%", "GOCR");
 //"subarea" is defined in map file
 //[SignIn]
 //subarea=="0,0,50%,50%"
 Component.GetTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn,"SignInPartialText", "subarea");
 //or
 //"subarea" is defined in map file
 //[ApplicationConstants]
 //subarea=="0,0,50%,50%"
 Component.GetTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "SignInPartialText", Map.subarea, "TOCR");

      • GUIDoesExist

        public static boolean GUIDoesExist(Component comp)
        Verify the visual existence of a particular window and/or component. See Detailed Reference

        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map).
        Returns:
        boolean, true if GUI exists; false if GUI does not exist or execution fail.
        Example:
         Component.GUIDoesExist(Map.AUT.EditBox);

      • GUIDoesNotExist

        public static boolean GUIDoesNotExist(Component comp)
        Verify the visual non-existence of a particular window and/or component. See Detailed Reference

        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map).
        Returns:
        boolean, true if GUI does not exist; false if GUI does exist or execution fail.
        Example:
         Component.GUIDoesNotExist(Map.AUT.EditBox);

      • HoverMouse

        public static boolean HoverMouse(Component comp,
                 java.lang.String... optionals)
        Hover the mouse over a component. See Detailed Reference
        Parameters:
        comp - org.safs.model.Component, the component to hover.
        optionals -
          optionals[0] coordination String, The offset from center of component, such as "200;400", or a mapKey defined under "ComponentName" or "ApplicationConstants" in map file.
          optionals[1] hoverTime int, milliseconds to hover
        Returns:
        true if hover succeeds, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         boolean success = Component.HoverMouse(Map.AUT.EditBox);//hover at the center of EditBox for 2 seconds
 boolean success = Component.HoverMouse(Map.AUT.EditBox, "50, 30", "1000");//hover at (50,30) of EditBox for 1 second
 boolean success = Component.HoverMouse(Map.AUT.EditBox, "locKey", "3000");//locKey="500, 300" defined in map file under "EditBox" or "ApplicationConstants"

      • InputKeys

        public static boolean InputKeys(Component comp,
                java.lang.String textvalue)
        Sends keystrokes to the specified Component.

        This supports special key characters like: 

             {Enter} = ENTER Key
     {Tab} = TAB Key
     ^ = CONTROL Key with another key ( "^s" = CONTROL + s )
     % = ALT Key with another key ( "%F" = ALT + F )
     + = SHIFT Key with another key ( "+{Enter}" = SHIFT + ENTER )
        We are generally providing this support through our generic InputKeys Support.

        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map).
        textvalue - -- to send via input to the Component.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Component.inputKeys(String), SeleniumPlus.quote(String)
        Example:
         Component.InputKeys(Map.AUT.EditBox, quote("^a"));//"Ctrl+a" Select all text of this EditBox

      • TypeKeys

        public static boolean TypeKeys(java.lang.String textvalue)
        Sends AWT Robot keystrokes to whatever currently has keyboard focus. This is intended to work for both local and remote Selenium Servers (when Remote RMI is properly enabled).

        This supports special key characters like: 

             {Enter} = ENTER Key
     {Tab} = TAB Key
     ^ = CONTROL Key with another key ( "^s" = CONTROL + s )
     % = ALT Key with another key ( "%F" = ALT + F )
     + = SHIFT Key with another key ( "+{Enter}" = SHIFT + ENTER )
        We are generally providing special key support through our generic InputKeys Support.

        Parameters:
        textvalue - -- to send via Robot to the current keyboard focus.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        TypeChars(String), WDLibrary.inputKeys(WebElement,String), SeleniumPlus.quote(String)
        Example:
         Component.TypeKeys(quote("^a"));//"Ctrl+a" Select all text of this EditBox

      • InputCharacters

        public static boolean InputCharacters(Component comp,
                      java.lang.String textvalue)
        Sends key characters to the specified Component.

        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map).
        textvalue - -- to send via input to the Component.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Component.inputKeys(String), SeleniumPlus.quote(String)
        Example:
         Component.InputCharacters(Map.AUT.EditBox, "Test Value");
 Component.InputCharacters(Map.AUT.EditBox, quote("UTF-8"));
 Component.InputCharacters(Map.AUT.EditBox, quote("^NotVariable"));

      • TypeChars

        public static boolean TypeChars(java.lang.String textvalue)
        Sends key characters to the current keyboard focus via AWT Robot. This is intended to work for both local and remote Selenium Servers (when Remote RMI is properly enabled).

        Parameters:
        textvalue - -- to send via input by AWT Robot.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        TypeKeys(String), WDLibrary.inputChars(WebElement,String), SeleniumPlus.quote(String)
        Example:
         Component.TypeChars("Test Value");
 Component.TypeChars(quote("UTF-8"));
 Component.TypeChars(quote("^NotVariable"));

      • IsPropertyExist

        public static boolean IsPropertyExist(Component comp,
                      java.lang.String property,
                      java.lang.String variable)
        Verify if object's property exists or not.
        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map) to get property's existence.
        property - -- attribute or CSS property.
        variable - -- the name of the variable to receive the proeprty's existence.
        Returns:
        true on success, "true" or "false" will be saved to a variable according to the existence of property.
        Example:
         String PropertyExistVariable = "PropertyExistVariable";
 Component.IsPropertyExist(Map.AUT.Lable,"textContent", PropertyExistVariable);
 String existence = SeleniumPlus.GetVariableValue(PropertyExistVariable);

      • IsPropertyExist

        public static boolean IsPropertyExist(Component comp,
                      java.lang.String property)
                               throws SeleniumPlusException
        Verify if object's property exists or not.
        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map) to get property's existence.
        property - -- attribute or CSS property.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if property exists. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException - if the execution fails.
        Example:
         boolean existence = Component.IsPropertyExist(Map.AUT.Lable,"textContent");

      • LocateScreenImage

        public static boolean LocateScreenImage(Component comp,
                        java.lang.String variable,
                        java.lang.String... optionals)
        Store the location and dimensions of a component. See Detailed Reference
        Parameters:
        variable - String, The root name of the collection of variables to receive the location and dimensions.
        variable=x y w h [space delimited values]
        variable.x=x
        variable.y=y
        variable.w=w
        variable.h=h
        optionals -
          optionals[0] relativeTo String, "screen" or "parent". Default is "screen".
        Returns:
        true if the location and dimensions are stored successfully to variable, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         String variable = "editboxRect";
 boolean success = Component.LocateScreenImage(Map.AUT.EditBox, variable);//EditBox's screen location and dimension will be store to variable "editboxRect"
 String rect = GetVariableValue(variable);
 String x = GetVariableValue(variable+".x");
 String y = GetVariableValue(variable+".y");
 String w = GetVariableValue(variable+".w");
 String h = GetVariableValue(variable+".h");
 boolean success = Component.LocateScreenImage(Map.AUT.EditBox, variable, RELATIVE_TO_PARENT);//EditBox's relative location and dimension will be store to variable "editboxRect"

      • SaveTextFromGUI

        public static boolean SaveTextFromGUI(Component comp,
                      java.lang.String outputFile,
                      java.lang.String... params)
        Incorporate OCR technology to detect the text on a GUI component and save the text to a file. See Detailed Reference
        This requires that SAFS-OCR has been installed.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component (from App Map) from which to retrieve text.
        outputFile - String, The name of the file to store detected text.
        params - optional
          params[0] SubArea String, indicating partial image of the component to capture, it can be app map subkey referring a subarea or the subarea itself like "5,10, %50, %60"
          params[1] OCRId String, indicating the OCR used to recognize text. TOCR or GORC
          params[2] LangId String, representing the language in use for selected OCR to recognize text. "en", "cn" etc.
          params[3] ScaleRatio float, indicating the scale ratio for resizing the original image. "1.5"
        Returns:
        boolean, True on success and the text will be saved to a file.
        Example:
         Component.SaveTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "signin.txt");
 Component.SaveTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "D:\data\test\signin.txt");
 Component.SaveTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "signin.txt", "", "GOCR");
 Component.SaveTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "signin.txt", "5,10, %50, %60", "TOCR", "en", "1.5");
 Component.SaveTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, quote("signin-partial.txt"), "0, 0, 70%, 100%", "GOCR");
 //"subarea" is defined in map file
 //[SignIn]
 //subarea=="0,0,50%,50%"
 Component.SaveTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn,"SignInPartialText.txt", "subarea");
 //or
 //"subarea" is defined in map file
 //[ApplicationConstants]
 //subarea=="0,0,50%,50%"
 Component.SaveTextFromGUI(Map.Google.SignIn, "D:\data\test\SignInPartialText.txt", Map.subarea, "TOCR");

      • VerifyComputedStyle

        public static boolean VerifyComputedStyle(Component comp,
                          java.lang.String benchfile)
        Verify computed CSS style against bench mark. If there is no benchmark file found then the test will fail. User responsibility to copy bench mark to the project benchmark folder.
        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map) to verify computed CSS style.
        benchfile - -- benchmark json file name from the project benchmark dir or User specify full path.
        Returns:
        -- True on success or A file will be created into Actuals dir on failure.
        Example:
         Component.VerifyComputedStyle(Map.Google.SignIn,"benmarkfile.json");
 Component.VerifyComputedStyle(Map.Google.SignIn,"c:\\temp\\file.json");

      • GetComputedStyle

        public static boolean GetComputedStyle(Component comp,
                       java.lang.String testfile)
        Save component's computed CSS style to a test file.
        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map) to verify computed CSS style.
        testfile - -- test json file name from the project test dir or User specify full path.
        Returns:
        -- True on success
        Example:
         Component.GetComputedStyle(Map.Google.SignIn,"testfile.json");
 Component.GetComputedStyle(Map.Google.SignIn,"c:\\temp\\file.json");

                     java.lang.String property,
                     java.lang.String value)
        Verify object property. The property could be attribute or CSS property.
        Parameters:
        comp - -- Component (from App Map) to verify property.
        property - -- attribute or CSS property.
        value - -- property value to be verified.
        Returns:
        true on success.

      • VerifyPropertyContains

        public static boolean VerifyPropertyContains(Component comp,
                             java.lang.String property,
                             java.lang.String containedValue)
        Verify that the value of an object property contains a string.
        The property could be attribute or CSS property.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to verify property.
        property - String, attribute or CSS property.
        containedValue - String, property value to be verified.
        Returns:
        true on success.

      • VerifyPropertyContains

        public static boolean VerifyPropertyContains(Component comp,
                             java.lang.String property,
                             java.lang.String containedValue,
                             boolean caseSensitive)
        Verify that the value of an object property contains a string.
        The property could be attribute or CSS property.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to verify property.
        property - String, attribute or CSS property.
        containedValue - String, property value to be verified.
        caseSensitive - boolean, if the comparaison is case-sensitive or not.
        Returns:
        true on success.
        Example:
         Component.VerifyPropertyContains(Map.Google.SignIn, "font-family", "Helvetica");
 Component.VerifyPropertyContains(Map.Google.SignIn, "font-family", "HELVETICA", false);

      • VerifyPropertyToFile

        public static boolean VerifyPropertyToFile(Component comp,
                           java.lang.String property,
                           java.lang.String benchFile,
                           java.lang.String... params)
        Verify the value of a single object property with a benchmark file.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to verify property.
        property - String, attribute or CSS property to verify.
        benchFile - String, The file containing the value of the property to compare.
        params - --
          params[0] -- optional -- The file encoding.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         boolean success = Component.VerifyPropertyToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "font-family", "bench.font.family.dat");
 boolean success = Component.VerifyPropertyToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "font-family", "bench.font.family.dat", "utf-8");

      • VerifyPropertiesToFile

        public static boolean VerifyPropertiesToFile(Component comp,
                             java.lang.String benchFile,
                             java.lang.String... params)
        Compare/Verify all of the value properties of a test object with a benchmark file.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to verify property.
        benchFile - String, The file containing the values of the properties to compare.
        params - --
          params[0] -- optional -- The file encoding.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         boolean success = Component.VerifyPropertiesToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "signin.properties");
 boolean success = Component.VerifyPropertiesToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "signin.properties", "utf-8");

      • VerifyPropertiesSubsetToFile

        public static boolean VerifyPropertiesSubsetToFile(Component comp,
                                   java.lang.String benchFile,
                                   java.lang.String... params)
        Compare/Verify the value properties of a test object with a benchmark file.
        Only those property names and values in the benchmark file will be compared.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to verify property.
        benchFile - String, The file containing the value of the properties to compare.
        params - --
          params[0] -- optional -- The file encoding.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         boolean success = Component.VerifyPropertiesSubsetToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "signinSubset.properties");
 boolean success = Component.VerifyPropertiesSubsetToFile(Map.Google.SignIn, "signinSubset.properties", "utf-8");

      • VerifyObjectDataToFile

        public static boolean VerifyObjectDataToFile(Component comp,
                             java.lang.String benchFile,
                             java.lang.String... params)
        Verify the current contents of a component's data with a benchmark file.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to retrieve data.
        benchFile - String, The benchmark file containing the date to compare.
        params - optional--
          params[0] -- The file encoding.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         boolean success = Component.VerifyObjectDataToFile(Map.SampleApp.ListView, "listview.dat");
 boolean success = Component.VerifyObjectDataToFile(Map.SampleApp.ListView, "listview.dat", "utf-8");
 boolean success = Component.VerifyObjectDataToFile(Map.SampleApp.ListView, "d:\testproj\bench\listview.dat");

      • ShowOnPage

        public static boolean ShowOnPage(Component comp,
                 java.lang.String... params)
        Make the component visible on the page.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component, (from App Map) to be visible on page.
        params - optional
          optionals[0] verify boolean, verify that the component is shown on page. The default value is false.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SeleniumPlus.prevResults, TestRecordData.getStatusCode(), TestRecordData.getStatusInfo()
        Example:
         //Try to make Map.SampleApp.EditBox becomes visible on page
 boolean success = Component.ShowOnPage(Map.SampleApp.EditBox);
 //Try to make Map.SampleApp.EditBox becomes visible on page and verify that it is shown.
 boolean success = Component.ShowOnPage(Map.SampleApp.EditBox, "true");
